intro: Uapaca kibuati, commonly known as the Kibuati velvetball, is a deciduous shrub native to the tropical rainforests of East Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, spherical clusters of dark purple berries. The plant has elliptical,革质 (leathery) leaves that are opposite in arrangement. Its flowers are small, clustered, and typically white or pale yellow. The fruit is edible and has a distinctive, slightly sour flavor, making it a valuable resource in local communities.
